# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. The most notable technical point was made by user "0mka" regarding potential changes needed to how LiveKit works in the core rather than via HYP. There's also a brief mention of an upcoming release that user "Ashxn" indicates will happen "in the next couple of days," with "0mka" suggesting it should mention dependency on elizaOS. The chat includes sharing of a YouTube link, discussion about roles, and brief mentions of market price discussions. There's also a question about a "MIC.hyp" feature that would allow voice to be heard by everyone on a map, but this doesn't receive a technical response.

## 2. FAQ

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The discussion centers around a technical issue where some users cannot join a virtual world due to WebSocket connection errors. The error appears to be related to incorrect protocol configuration in environment variables, specifically using "https://" instead of "wss://" for WebSocket connections. Ash identified that while the user's .env file shows the correct "wss://" protocol for PUBLIC_WS_URL, the actual application is somehow using incorrect values from elsewhere. The issue manifests inconsistently, with some devices/browsers allowing the incorrect protocol while others strictly follow the WebSocket specification. Additionally, the user reports resource loading failures that persist after preloading. Ash ultimately suggests that the problems may stem from modifications to the core engine, recommending testing with an unmodified standard server to isolate the issue source.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Why can some people join the world but others cannot? (asked by Coinexpert) A: Some devices/browsers allow using https:// for websocket urls but it's not valid to the specification. (answered by ash)
Q: Is the problem not the env? (asked by Coinexpert) A: The .env looks correct, but the application is getting incorrect values from somewhere else. (answered by ash)
Q: How to fix "Fail to load resource" errors? (asked by Coinexpert) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: ash | Helpee: Coinexpert | Context: WebSocket connection errors with incorrect protocol | Resolution: Identified that while .env file was correct, the application was using incorrect values from elsewhere
Helper: maximus | Helpee: Coinexpert | Context: WebSocket connection errors | Resolution: Suggested checking for VPN interference and reviewing server config file
Helper: ash | Helpee: Coinexpert | Context: Ongoing technical issues | Resolution: Recommended testing with unmodified standard server since custom modifications could be causing unpredictable problems

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Test with unmodified standard server to isolate issue source | Mentioned By: ash
Type: Technical | Description: Investigate resource loading failures that persist after preloading | Mentioned By: Coinexpert
